result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zoe Hannah Saatzer

records.addlTxt: Statewide. Signed by SRN on 11/3/22. arc   c: SCSO with complaint   e:DA and Atty Perrin.
Unpaid October 1 & November 1, 2022, attorney fees.  ($75.00 due per month)  This person may be released upon the payment of $150.00

8:47 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Zoe Hannah Saatzer in court.  Attorney Shirlene Renee Perrin in court for Zoe Hannah Saatzer.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau for ADA Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA Damrau states he believes this case should be a Misd not a CF case, requesting to dismiss count one and State will file motion to dismiss count 2 and 3 after a new criminal complaint with CM case number is filed.  On motion of the state court dismisses count 1. As to Count 2 & 3- Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG's. DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 9:05 AM. bph
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

$250 bond on file.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Christopher H.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
for Bond modification. Filed by Victim. arc   Per SRN on 9/13/22, granted. Per JA, will call DE to come in and sign amended bond. rg/gll

Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file and notes PH has not been held.  Atty Perrin states she would prefer to have PH.  Court notes bond modification request from victim and requests Turning Point to address form before Court will address.  DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 9:03 AM. bph
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Filed by DA's Office. km

$250 bond on file.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Christopher H. or his residence EXCEPT by text message regarding children only.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Defendant may retrieve personal belongings in the presence of law enforcement only.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

2:00 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Zoe Hannah Saatzer in court.  Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court for Zoe Hannah Saatzer. DE doesnt' qualify for PD. DE confirms address and DOB. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waive reading. Bond argument; bond ordered. PFAC given. Waive speedy prelim. Court sets PSC. Adjourned at 2:0 PM.  gll
